intro: Sedum chontalense, commonly known as the Chontalense stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in the spring. It prefers well-draining soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its adaptability and low maintenance make it an attractive option for gardeners in dry climates.
